intro: Diasperus nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, commonly known as the spurge family, and is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous areas, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Diasperus nepalensis is often used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
